name: 劉俊麟
objective: The course aims to provide a comprehensive introduction to Internet and computer networking technologies. Unlike traditional course, it pursues a top-down approach to the topics, starting with the application layer and then describing the transport and network layers, finally covering the physical layer. The topics covered in course are: (1) Network Application, (2) TCP and UDP protocols, (3) Network Layer - Data Plane, (4) Network Layer - Control Plane, (5) Link Layer & Local Area Networks, (6) Wireless and Mobile Network, and (7) Multimedia Networking.
schedule:
Week 1, 2
0. Computer Networks course overview
1. Computer Networks and the Internet
1.1 What is the Internet, 1.2 The Network Edge, 1.3 The Network Core
1.4 Delay, Loss, and Throughput in Packet-Switched Networks, 
1.5 Protocol Layers and Their Service Models, 1.6 Network Under Attack, 1.7 History of Internet
Week 3, 4, 5: 
2. Application Layer
2.1 Principles of Network Applications, 
2.2 Web and HTTP, 2.3 FTP, 
2.4 E-Mail in the Internet
2.5 DNS, 2.6 P2P Applications, 
2.7 Socket Programming with TCP, 
2.8 Socket Programming with UDP
Week 6, 7, 8
3. Transport Layer
3.1 Introduction to Transport-Layer Services, 3.2 Multiplexing and Demultiplexing, 
3.3 Connectionless Transport: UDP
3.4 Principle of Reliable Data Transfer
3.5 Connection-Oriented Transport: TCP, 
3.6 Principle of Congestion Control, 
3.7 TCP Congestion Control
Week 9: Midterm Exam.

Week 10, 11: 
4. The Network Layer: Data Plane
4.1 Introduction, 
4.2 What's Inside a Router, 
4.3 The Internet Protocol (IP), 
4.4 Generalized Forwarding and SDN
Week 12, 13:
5. The Network Layer: Control Plane
5.1 Introduction
5.2 Routing Algorithm
5.3 Intra-AS Routing in thr Internet: OSPF
5.4 Routing Among the ISPs: BGP
5.5 The SDN Control Plane
5.6 ICMP
5.7 Networking Management and SNMP
Week 14, 15: 
6. Link Layer and LAN
6.1 Introduction
6.2 Error-Detection and -Correction Techniques
6.3 Multiple Access Links and Protocols
6.4 Switch Local Area Networks
6.5 Link Virtualization
6.6 Data Center Networking
Week 16, 17:
7. Wireless and Mobile Networks
7.1 Introduction
7.2 Wireless Links and Network Characteristics, 7.3 WiFi
7.4 Cellular Internet Access
7.5 Mobility Management
7.6 Mobile IP
7.7 Managing Mobility in Cellular Networks
7.8 Wireless and Mobility
Week 18: Final exam.
